required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: RCT of Ethiodized Poppyseed Oil VS the Second-generation Non-ionic Monomer Contrast in Hysterosalpingography of Infertile Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, the Second-generation Non-ionic Monomer Contrast Parallel Control, Multicenter Clinical Study to Evaluate the Imaging Diagnostic Quality and Fertility Promoting Effect of Ethiodized Poppyseed Oil in Hysterosalpingography of Infertile Patients.

lead_sponsor.agency: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

clinical_study.source: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the difference of imaging diagnostic quality and fertility promoting effect in the diagnosis and treatment of infertility by hysterosalpingography between using ethiodized poppyseed oil and the second-generation non-ionic monomer contrast. Half of participants will receive ethiodized poppyseed oil for hysterosalpingography, while the other half will receive the second-generation non-ionic monomer contrast for hysterosalpingography.

primary_outcome.description: defined as mean scores of 3 pictures shot at certain points

primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 months （6 months for recruitment, 9 months for ongoing pregnancy）
primary_outcome.description: defined as the first day of the last menstrual cycle for the pregnancy is within 6 months after randomization, and after 12 weeks of gestation a positive fetal heartbeat is on ultrasonographic examination

intervention.description: Hysterosalpingography using the second-generation non-ionic monomer contrast

overall_official.affiliation: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center
responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of medical imaging, Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: It is not yet known if there will be a plan to make IPD available.
